risk_factors.reasoning: The individual has been arrested 10 times and convicted, indicating a pattern of behavior that may suggest a higher likelihood of reoffending.
Having a GED certificate but not being enrolled in college may indicate a lack of educational opportunities or motivation to improve socio-economic status.
The individual has only held one job during the year, which may suggest instability and limited economic prospects.
A history of using drugs in the past four years may indicate underlying issues that could contribute to reoffending or poor life choices.
The individual has not felt depressed over the past month, which may suggest relatively good mental health and a lower risk of reoffending due to substance abuse or mental health issues.
Grew up in an urban area with both biological parents, but this information is not directly related to the likelihood of being rearrested within 3 years.
The individual attributes personal events to God, which may suggest a sense of purpose or morality that could mitigate reoffending.
